Miles Morales is Spider-Man in Brooklyn on Earth-1610.
Gwen travels to Miles' dimension and they reconnect, sharing their struggles and hinting at feelings of attraction towards each other.
The Spot blames Miles for causing his mutation, as the radioactive spider that bit Miles and gave him his powers came from Earth-42 while the Spot was testing the Alchemax collider.
The Spot accidentally transports himself into a void and learns to use his portals to travel other universes by using Alchemax colliders in other dimensions.

Miles is having trouble with his parents due to his duties as Spider-Man interfering with his personal life, and is grounded when he is late to a party celebrating his father Jeff's promotion to police captain.

The trailer showcases one of the two alternate Earths as Earth-50101, which has been nicknamed 'Mumbattan' due to its fusion with Mumbai and Manhattan from the Gotham Entertainment Group's Spider-Man: India comic book series.
To give the character Pavitr Prabhakar unique motion and fighting style, the creative team researched the 2000-year-old Indian martial arts, Kalaripayattu, from the state of Kerala.
The other universe seen in the trailer is Nueva York, the futuristic New York City from the Marvel 2099 world, which has been heavily influenced by Syd Mead's neo-futurist illustrations.
The architecture of Oscar Niemeyer has also been an inspiration for the city's design in Nueva York.

node_2: authoritarian, brutalist and minimalist style of design
edge: The city was created as a highly controlled environment reflecting Miguel's personality, and has an authoritarian, brutalist and minimalist style of design meant to represent a 'clean, strong, unified, front-facing ideology'.
But when going underground one realizes that it's a world that can't really be controlled.
Spider-Punk is the punky alter ego of Miles Morales in the New London universe revealed by Joaquim Dos Santos during an interview with Empire.
New London is a punky universe inhabited by Spider-Punk, as revealed by Joaquim Dos Santos during an interview with Empire.

node_2: world that miles' spider originated from and became the prowler
edge: Earth-42 is a world that Miles' spider originated from and where he has become the Prowler, as later revealed.

The animation style of Spider-Punk took two to three years to develop and is inspired by collage imagery of 1970s punk-rock album covers, posters, and zines emulating the look of Xerox prints, colored papers and images appropriated from magazines and newsprints, and has a general grayed-out quality due to copy machines not having toner in them.
The animators experimented with different frame rates for Spider-Punk's body to reflect DIY punk visuals and Spider-Punk's anarchic personality and tendency of inconsistency.
The animators experimented with different frame rates for Spider-Punk's guitar to reflect DIY punk visuals and Spider-Punk's anarchic personality and tendency of inconsistency.
The animators experimented with different frame rates for Spider-Punk's outline to reflect DIY punk visuals and Spider-Punk's anarchic personality and tendency of inconsistency.

In May 2023, Powers revealed that the film would end on a cliffhanger for the character Matteo Silvini. This suggests that the fate of the character will be left uncertain, similar to how the Empire Strikes Back ended with the revelation that Darth Vader was Luke Skywalker's father.

Dos Santos compared the ending of The Matrix Resurrections to that of The Empire Strikes Back. This implies that both films have similar narrative devices, such as leaving certain plot elements unresolved at the end of the movie.

Miguel makes a direct reference to the events of Spider-Man: No Way Home in Across The Spider-Verse, attributing it to the collider explosion from Into the Spider-Verse. In the same movie, Miguel also mentions Doctor Strange and the Spider-Man of Earth-19999 (MCU) as a little nerd, indicating a potential connection between the two cinematic universes.

In Across The Spider-Verse, Donald Glover reprises his role as an alternate version of Aaron Davis / Prowler from the MCU film Spider-Man: Homecoming (2017). However, in this movie, he is depicted as a prisoner of the Spider-Society displaced from his home reality.

node_2: longest animated film ever produced by an american studio
edge: Across the Spider-Verse, with a runtime of 140 minutes, surpassed Consuming Spirits (2012) to become the longest animated film ever produced by an American studio.

node_2: production on across the spider-verse was completed
edge: On May 20, 2023, production on Across the Spider-Verse was completed.

Lord's directions for numerous requests for changes to already finished animation and the need for him to approve animation layouts early in production took precedence over the decisions of the film's directing team, leading to difficult working conditions caused by constant revisions. This resulted in numerous weeks of long overtime as the animators drastically revised portions of the film several times, causing over 100 artists to leave the project before its completion.

The constant revisions caused by Lord's directions for numerous requests for changes to already finished animation and the need for him to approve animation layouts early in production led to difficult working conditions that caused over 100 artists to leave the project before its completion.

node_2: allegations concerning across the spider-verse's production troubles
edge: Four people who worked on the film alleged that production had faced difficulties due to numerous requests from Lord for changes to already finished animation, as well as the need for him to approve animation layouts early in production.

The allegations concerning Across the Spider-Verse's production troubles also stated that Into the Spider-Verse and The Mitchells vs. the Machines, two earlier movies that Lord and Miller co-produced for Sony, suffered from similar production issues.

Daniel Kaluuya incorporated musical elements into his vocal performance as Spider-Punk / Hobie Brown, with the character's voice feeling like a song. Kaluuya searched for the word 'Spider-Punk' on Spotify to find fan-made playlists and listened to them to gauge the character's energy. In one take, Kaluuya portrayed the character as rapping in a punk style, which was used in the film.

In response to complaints from viewers, Sony sent an updated version of the film with new audio mixing to theaters.
While issues were only present at a 'handful of theaters', all prints of the film had been updated and re-sent to cinemas.

The film briefly features transgender iconography, such as a transgender flag on a banner seen hanging in Gwen Stacy's bedroom with the words 'Protect Trans Kids'. This led to speculation that Gwen supports her universe's transgender rights movement and interpretations of Gwen‚Äôs story being a transgender allegory. Some interpreted Gwen herself as being transgender.

The use of the flag's colors (light pink, light blue, and white) elsewhere in scenes involving Gwen and her universe were noted by viewers and critics who supported the interpretation that Gwen is transgender. However, others have pointed out that these colors were already used by the comics' version of Spider-Woman Gwen Stacy and thus may not necessarily prove that the film version of the character is trans.
The film's release initially was delayed in the MENA region until June 22, 2023, but later withdrawn from cinemas across the region because of the film's brief feature of transgender iconography.

95% of 386 critics' reviews for 'Spider-Man: Across the Spider-Verse' on Rotten Tomatoes are positive, with an average rating of 8.6/10.

node_2: national board of review award for best animated film
edge: IndieWire listed Spider-Man: Across the Spider-Verse as the second greatest animated film of the 21st century. The National Board of Review awarded it with the National Board of Review Award for Best Animated Film.
Spider-Man: Across the Spider-Verse received seven Annie Awards, winning all in a clean sweep.

Spider-Man: Across the Spider-Verse received three Critics' Choice Movie Awards, winning one. It also won the National Board of Review Award for Best Animated Film and received two British Academy Film Awards.
Spider-Man: Across the Spider-Verse received three Golden Globe Award nominations.
Guillermo del Toro, the winner of the 2022 Oscar for Best animated film, praised the film, saying "Spider-Man: Across the Spider-Verse will fulfill and heal."
During a London Q&A screening, Andrew Garfield called the film "a masterpiece of pure cinema."
Bryce Dallas Howard, who played Gwen Stacy in Spider-Man 3 (2007), expressed her and her father, Ron Howard's, love for the movie, calling it "an astonishing film on every level".
The filmmakers behind Kung Fu Panda 4 cited the Spider-Man: Across the Spider-Verse films as inspiration for their fight scenes, incorporating an "inkbrush" style.
The meme involving the notion of canon events began spreading on TikTok after the film's release, leading to its popularity as a trend.

The meme's word 'canon' elaborated its special definition as 'ironic (if not actually painful)' experiences in real life.

While Sony Pictures CEO Tony Vinciquerra discussed exploring opportunities to make films less expensive and more efficient using AI in May 2024, Miller clarified that generative AI would not be used in Beyond the Spider-Verse. He explained that they aim to create visual styles that have not been used in major studio computer-generated films and avoid repurposing other artists' work through AI.
Some machine learning technology, distinct from generative AI, had been used by Sony Pictures Imageworks to assist animators during the production of the Spider-Verse franchise's preceding films.
Karan Soni revealed in August 2024 that voice recording for Beyond the Spider-Verse was scheduled to begin 'in a few months'.
